intro: Plantago pauciflora var. major, commonly known as the greater plantain, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal rosettes of broad, lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers in late spring to early summer, which are borne on slender, leafless stalks. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in roadsides, fields, and waste areas. Its leaves are commonly used in traditional medicine for their soothing and healing properties.
